meanings.definition: A reduction in the intensity of light
meanings.sent1: During the storm, the dimout made it hard to see outside.
meanings.sent2: The dimout in the theater created a cozy atmosphere for the movie.
meanings.sent3: The dimout at the party made it feel like a mysterious gathering.
meanings.sent4: Her sadness cast a dimout over the whole room.
meanings.sent5: The dimout of the sunset painted the sky in soft hues.

meanings.definition: A period of reduced lighting, especially during wartime
meanings.sent1: The city implemented a dimout to protect against air raids.
meanings.sent2: The dimout during the blackout helped keep the city safe.
meanings.sent3: The dimout during the play added an unexpected twist to the scene.
meanings.sent4: The dimout of information during the meeting left everyone in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The dimout of streetlights created an eerie atmosphere in the neighborhood.
